summary: This is a court order from April 20, 2021, directing the parties in the Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell case to negotiate a schedule for outstanding pretrial disclosures, including Brady, Giglio, and Jencks Act materials, co-conspirator statements, witness information, victim identities, and 404(b) material. The order requires a joint proposal by April 21, 2021.

events.title: Deadline for Joint Proposal Submission
events.description: Court orders parties to submit a joint proposal for a schedule of outstanding pretrial disclosures; if no agreement, parties submit separate proposals.

locations.name: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
locations.context: Office location of the Assistant United States Attorney mentioned in the document.

keyFacts: The court is ordering the parties to negotiate a schedule for all outstanding pretrial disclosures in the Epstein/Maxwell case.
Required disclosures include Brady, Giglio, and Jencks Act materials, co-conspirator statements, witness statements, victim identities, and 404(b) material.
A joint proposal on the schedule was due by April 21, 2021; if no agreement, parties were to submit separate proposals.
The document references an 'S2 indictment', indicating a superseding indictment in the case.
The order is focused on procedural next steps for evidence sharing and motion briefing ahead of trial.
